result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin J. Rice

records.addlTxt: Notice of Hearing for Pre-trial on November 21, 2022 at 10:15am, NO SUCH NUMBER, UNABLE TO FORWARD, RETURN TO SENDER (Defendant Justin J. Rice)
Notice of Hearing for Return on Warrant/Initial Appearance on August 1, 2022 at 2:00pm-NO SUCH NUMBER, UNABLE TO FORWARD, RETURN TO SENDER (Respondent Justin Rice)
Pre-trial conference on November 21, 2022 at 10:15 am.
No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.  No possession of any drug paraphernalia.

3:21 PM Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin J. Rice in custody at Jefferson County Jail.  Attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria appeared by video for Justin J. Rice. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court orders $1000 Signature Bond with conditions: Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No possession of drug paraphernalia. Warrant to remain until Defendant back in Rock County. Defendants Attorney enters not guilty plea and matter to be set.

Activity:  Hearing  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

02:01 PM  Intern Verity Altenberger by video supervised by Noah Tylenda by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin J. Rice not in court.  Attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria appeared by video for Justin J. Rice.  Defendant is in Jefferson County Jail.  Matter continued.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on August 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
